verses.roman:
trimalla-tripadī-sthāna kaila daraśana
sarvatra karila kṛṣṇa-nāma pracāraṇa

synonyms: trimalla—a place named Trimalla; tripadī—or Tirupati; sthāna—the pace; kaila—did; daraśana—visit; sarvatra—everywhere: karila—did; kṛṣṇa-nāma—the holy name of Lord Kṛṣṇa; pracāraṇa—preaching.
translation: He visited the place known as Trimalla, or Tirupati, and there He extensively preached the chanting of the Lord's holy name.

purport.content: This holy place is situated in the district of Tāñjor, South India. The temple of Tripadī is situated in the valley of Veṅkaṭācala (Veṅkaṭa Mountain) and contains a Deity of Lord Rāmacandra. On top of Veṅkaṭācala is the famous temple of Bālājī.
